solution_line_template: One square yard is the same as {yard_to_feet} feet by {yard_to_feet} feet, or {yard_to_feet}*{yard_to_feet}=<<{one_sq_yard_multiplier}*{yard_to_feet}*{yard_to_feet}={sq_feet_per_sq_yard}>>{sq_feet_per_sq_yard} square feet.

Ten square yards is {sq_feet_per_sq_yard}*{num_sq_yards_per_rabbit_per_day}=<<{num_sq_yards_per_rabbit_per_day}*{sq_feet_per_sq_yard}={sq_feet_per_rabbit_per_day}>>{sq_feet_per_rabbit_per_day} square feet.

Therefore, {num_rabbits} rabbits can clear {num_rabbits}*{sq_feet_per_rabbit_per_day}=<<{num_rabbits}*{sq_feet_per_rabbit_per_day}={total_clearance_per_day}>>{total_clearance_per_day} square feet of grassland per day.
A {land_length_ft} ft by {land_width_ft} ft area is {land_length_ft}*{land_width_ft}=<<{land_length_ft}*{land_width_ft}={total_land_area_sq_feet}>>{total_land_area_sq_feet} square feet.

Thus, {total_land_area_sq_feet} sq ft can be cleared by {num_rabbits} rabbits in {total_land_area_sq_feet}/{total_clearance_per_day}=<<{total_land_area_sq_feet}/{total_clearance_per_day}={days_to_clear}>>{days_to_clear} days
